ThresholdMetricId.description: In an alarm based on an anomaly detection model, this is the ID of the ANOMALY_DETECTION_BAND function used as the threshold for the alarm.

EvaluateLowSampleCountPercentile.description: Used only for alarms based on percentiles.

ExtendedStatistic.description: The percentile statistic for the metric associated with the alarm. Specify a value between p0.0 and p100.

ComparisonOperator.description: The arithmetic operation to use when comparing the specified statistic and threshold.

TreatMissingData.description: Sets how this alarm is to handle missing data points. Valid values are breaching, notBreaching, ignore, and missing.

Dimensions.description: The dimensions for the metric associated with the alarm. For an alarm based on a math expression, you can't specify Dimensions. Instead, you use Metrics.

Period.description: The period in seconds, over which the statistic is applied.

EvaluationPeriods.description: The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified threshold.

Unit.description: The unit of the metric associated with the alarm.

Namespace.description: The namespace of the metric associated with the alarm.

OKActions.description: The actions to execute when this alarm transitions to the OK state from any other state.

AlarmActions.description: The list of actions to execute when this alarm transitions into an ALARM state from any other state.

MetricName.description: The name of the metric associated with the alarm.

ActionsEnabled.description: Indicates whether actions should be executed during any changes to the alarm state. The default is TRUE.

Metrics.description: An array that enables you to create an alarm based on the result of a metric math expression.

Statistic.description: The statistic for the metric associated with the alarm, other than percentile.

InsufficientDataActions.description: The actions to execute when this alarm transitions to the INSUFFICIENT_DATA state from any other state.

Arn.description: Amazon Resource Name is a unique name for each resource.

DatapointsToAlarm.description: The number of datapoints that must be breaching to trigger the alarm.

Threshold.description: In an alarm based on an anomaly detection model, this is the ID of the ANOMALY_DETECTION_BAND function used as the threshold for the alarm.

MetricStat.description: This structure defines the metric to be returned, along with the statistics, period, and units.

Period.description: The granularity, in seconds, of the returned data points.

Metric.description: The metric to return, including the metric name, namespace, and dimensions.

Unit.description: The unit to use for the returned data points.

Metric.description: The Metric property type represents a specific metric.

Dimension.description: Dimensions are arbitrary name/value pairs that can be associated with a CloudWatch metric.

MetricDataQuery.description: This property type specifies the metric data to return, and whether this call is just retrieving a batch set of data for one metric, or is performing a math expression on metric data.

Label.description: A human-readable label for this metric or expression.

MetricStat.description: The metric to be returned, along with statistics, period, and units.

Id.description: A short name used to tie this object to the results in the response.

ReturnData.description: This option indicates whether to return the timestamps and raw data values of this metric.

Expression.description: The math expression to be performed on the returned data.

Period.description: The period in seconds, over which the statistic is applied.

AccountId.description: The ID of the account where the metrics are located, if this is a cross-account alarm.
